creator: rkreisel@mediaone.net
text:
When displaying the page generated by the example servlet, (from the outside 
world), the wait cursor continues until the server times out. If the port 
number (8080) is included the page displays and the wait cursor stops. This 
problem is confusing because I get different (but consistent) results when I 
access the servlet from inside my firewall. All of the urls below point to the 
same class file on my server.

rkreisel.dhs.org/examples/servlets/RequestInfoExample - works on my internal 
network regardless of OS, but "hangs" if accessed via an external ISP

rkreisel.dhs.org:8080/examples/servlets/RequestInfoExample - works regardless 
of OS or ISP of requestor, (unless the requestor is behind another firewall, 
like at work, where that firewall blocks 8080. In that case nothing is returned 
because my server never receives the request??)

nt40srvr/examples/servlets/RequestInfoExample - on the internal network the 
page is displayed, but the wait cursor continues until timeout under Win 9x, 
but it works under NT 4.0 (workstation)

nt40srvr:8080/examples/servlets/RequestInfoExample - on the internal network it 
works correctly (completes) regardless of the OS

p.s. This applies to jsp's as well

I would like to use Tomcat in a "production" environment for a small site I 
maintain on my server, but this bug will confuse my users (my junior and senior 
high Sunday School class)

p.s. I noticed a couple postings on this topic in the mail list, but the 
suggested solutions were no help.

p.p.s. This may be a duplicate bug report, but I could not find anything 
through the search engine. This one is difficult to describe in a few keywords!

creator: rkreisel@mediaone.net
text:
Server is NT 4.0 (sp6a).
Web server is IIS 3.0 (I know Tomcat has only been tested w/4.0, but I'm hoping 
this is not an IIS problem).
Server also runs Winproxy which contains a firewall. I have opened ports 8080 
and 8007 for both incoming and outgoing TCP and UDP.
Internet connection is a cable "modem".

creator: rkreisel@mediaone.net
text:
I have given up on Tomcat and gone to Resin (which, by the way, works fine). As 
a result, I re-targeted the "examples" context. The above URL, therefore, will 
not work. If someone comes up with a solution I would still like to know, 
because Tomcat is a little easier to configure than Resin, and I would prefer 
to use it instead.
